content:
Your morning routine is important, and it's great that you're thinking about how to fit in your priorities.

Let's assume you want to leave the house at the same time as you would if you were taking the bus, which would give you enough time to grab a cup of coffee and check your emails before heading out.

**Revised cycling commute plan:**

* Leave the house 45 minutes earlier than your usual bus departure time
* Allow 15-20 minutes to grab a cup of coffee and check your emails
* Allocate the remaining 25-30 minutes for your cycling commute

This should give you a comfortable buffer to account for any unexpected delays or slower cycling times, especially if you're new to cycling.

Remember to factor in your cycling gear, such as putting on your helmet, gloves, and any other safety equipment, as well as locking up your bike when you arrive at work.

By leaving a bit earlier and allowing some extra time for your morning routine, you should be able to fit in your coffee and emails while still enjoying the benefits of cycling to work.
